getFolder

public static Object getFolder(DocsService self,
                               Object options,
                               String foldername)
                        throws MalformedURLException,
                               IOException,
                               ServiceException
retrieves one or several Folder(s) as FolderEntry querying DocumentFeed with a name (exact match or not) and manages single/multiple results using tuple results (FolderEntry(s), GApiStatus). Take into account the result is a tuple and not a single variable.
For example:
def (folder, res) = service.getFolder("test1")
def (folder) = service.getFolder("test1")
def (_,res) = service.getFolder("test1")
def (folder,res) = service.getFolder("test1", exact:false)
def (folder,res) = service.getFolder("test1", hidden:true, exact:false)
def (folder,res) = service.getFolder("test1", exact:false, trashed:true, hidden:false,)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
foldername - the folder name to look for.
options - Specifies function options.
For example:
exact: true hidden: true trashed: true Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
exactspecifies whether the title query should be taken as an exact string. This is the same as google api "title-exact" query parameter. booleantrue
hiddenspecifies whether the hidden docs should be shown. booleanfalse
trashedspecifies whether the trashed docs should be shown (apparently, trashed docs are not returned for the time being so this options is not useful now). booleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (null, GApiStatus.NOT_FOUND)
  • (FolderEntry, GApiStatus.MULTIPLE_FOUND)
  • (List<FolderEntry>, GApiStatus.SINGLE_FOUND)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException
ServiceException

createFolder

public static Object createFolder(DocsService self,
                                  Object options,
                                  String foldername)
                           throws MalformedURLException,
                                  IOException,
                                  ServiceException
creates a new Folder. Take into account the result is a tuple (FolderEntry, GApiStatus) and not a single variable.
For example:
def (folder, res) = service.createFolder("test1")
def (folder) = service.createFolder("test1")
def (_, res) = service.createFolder("test1")
def (folder, res) = service.createFolder("test1", force: true)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
foldername - the folder name to look for.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
force: true Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
forceforces or not the creation when an existing folder with the same name is foundbooleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (FolderEntry, OK)
  • (null, ALREADY_EXISTS)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException
ServiceException

deleteFolder

public static Object deleteFolder(DocsService self,
                                  Object options,
                                  String foldername)
                           throws MalformedURLException,
                                  IOException,
                                  ServiceException
deletes one or several Folder(s). Take into account the result is a tuple (GApiStatus, nbDeletedorFoundEntries) and not a single variable.
For example:
def (res, nb) = service.deleteFolder("test1")
def (res) = service.deleteFolder("test1", multiple:true)
def (res, _) = service.deleteFolder("test1", permanent:true)
def (res, nb) = service.deleteFolder("test1", multiple:true, permanent:true)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
foldername - the folder name to delete.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
multiple:true Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
multipleAllows deleting multiple found folders or notbooleanfalse
permanentAllows deleting permanently (not trashed) found folders or notbooleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (NOT_FOUND, 0)
  • (SINGLE_DELETED, 1)
  • (MULTIPLE_DELETED, nb_delete)
  • (MULTIPLE_FOUND, nb_found)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException
ServiceException

getDocument

public static Object getDocument(DocsService self,
                                 Object options,
                                 String docname)
                          throws MalformedURLException,
                                 IOException,
                                 ServiceException
retrieves one or several Document(s) as DocumentListEntry querying DocumentFeed with a name (exact match or not) and manages single/multiple results using tuple results (DocumentListEntry(s), GApiStatus). Take into account the result is a tuple and not a single variable.
For example:
def (doc, res) = service.getDocument("test1")
def (doc) = service.getDocument("test1")
def (_,res) = service.getDocument("test1")
def (folder,res) = service.getDocument("test1", exact:false)
def (folder,res) = service.getDocument("test1", hidden:true, exact:false)
def (folder,res) = service.getDocument("test1", exact:false, trashed:true, hidden:false,)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
docname - the document name to look for.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
[ "exact": true ] Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
exactspecifies whether the title query should be taken as an exact string. This is the same as google api "title-exact" query parameter. booleantrue
hidddenspecifies whether the hidden docs should be shown. booleanfalse
trashedspecifies whether the trashed docs should be shown (apparently, trashed docs are not returned for the time being so this options is not useful now). booleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (null, GApiStatus.NOT_FOUND)
  • (DocumentListEntry, GApiStatus.MULTIPLE_FOUND)
  • (List<DocumentListEntry>, GApiStatus.SINGLE_FOUND)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException
ServiceException

getDocument

public static Object getDocument(DocsService self,
                                 Object options,
                                 String docname,
                                 String foldername)
                          throws MalformedURLException,
                                 IOException,
                                 ServiceException
retrieves one or several Document(s) in a folder as DocumentListEntry querying DocumentFeed with a name (exact match or not) and manages single/multiple results using tuple results (DocumentListEntry(s), GApiStatus). Take into account the result is a tuple and not a single variable.
For example:
def (doc, res) = service.getDocument("test1", "folder1")
def (doc) = service.getDocument("test1", "folder1")
def (_,res) = service.getDocument("test1", "folder1")
def (folder,res) = service.getDocument("test1", "folder1", exact:false)
def (folder,res) = service.getDocument("test1", "folder1", hidden:true, exact:false)
def (folder,res) = service.getDocument("test1", "folder1", exact:false, trashed:true, hidden:false,)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
docname - the document name to look for.
foldername - the folder name to look for.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
[ "exact": true ] Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
exactspecifies whether the title query should be taken as an exact string. This is the same as google api "title-exact" query parameter. booleantrue
hidddenspecifies whether the hidden docs should be shown. booleanfalse
trashedspecifies whether the trashed docs should be shown (apparently, trashed docs are not returned for the time being so this options is not useful now). booleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (null, GApiStatus.NOT_FOUND)
  • (DocumentListEntry, GApiStatus.MULTIPLE_FOUND)
  • (List<DocumentListEntry>, GApiStatus.SINGLE_FOUND)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException
ServiceException

deleteDocument

public static Object deleteDocument(DocsService self,
                                    Object options,
                                    String docname)
                             throws MalformedURLException,
                                    IOException,
                                    ServiceException
deletes one or several Document(s). Take into account the result is a tuple (GApiStatus, nbDeletedorFoundEntries) and not a single variable.
For example:
def (res,nb) = service.deleteDocument("test1")
def (res) = service.deleteDocument("test1", multiple:true)
def (res,_) = service.deleteDocument("test1", permanent:true)
def (res,nb) = service.deleteDocument("test1", multiple:true, permanent:true)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
docname - the document name to delete.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
[ "multiple": true ] Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
multipleAllows deleting multiple found folders or notbooleanfalse
permanentAllows deleting permanently (not trashed) found folders or notbooleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (NOT_FOUND, 0)
  • (SINGLE_DELETED, 1)

  • (MULTIPLE_FOUND, nb_delete)

deleteDocument

public static Object deleteDocument(DocsService self,
                                    Object options,
                                    String docname,
                                    String foldername)
                             throws MalformedURLException,
                                    IOException,
                                    ServiceException
deletes one or several Document(s) in a folder. Take into account the result is a tuple (GApiStatus, nbDeletedorFoundEntries) and not a single variable.
For example:
def (res,nb) = service.deleteDocument("test1", "folder1")
def (res) = service.deleteDocument("test1", "folder1", multiple:true)
def (res, _) = service.deleteDocument("test1", "folder1", permanent:true)
def (res, nb) = service.deleteDocument("test1", "folder1", multiple:true, permanent:true)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
docname - the document name to delete.
foldername - the folder name to look for.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
multiple:true permanent:true Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
multipleAllows deleting multiple found folders or notbooleanfalse
permanentAllows deleting permanently (not trashed) found folders or notbooleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (NOT_FOUND, 0)
  • (SINGLE_DELETED, 1)
  • (MULTIPLE_DELETED, nb_delete)
  • (MULTIPLE_FOUND, nb_delete)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException
ServiceException

waitForFolderDeletion

public static Object waitForFolderDeletion(DocsService self,
                                           Object options,
                                           String folderName)
waits for folder deletion by interrogating the DocsService periodically for this folder until it is not found anymore and sleeping between 2 tries... (not very elegant :) ) The result is a tuple [GApiStatus, number_of_milliseconds].
For example:
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForFolderDeletion("folder1")
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForFolderDeletion("folder1", maxcount:20, delay:2000)
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForFolderDeletion("folder1", maxcount:20)
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForFolderDeletion("folder1", delay:2000)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
folderName - the folder name to look for.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
maxcount: 15 delay": 2000 Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
maxcountmaximum retry number before giving-upinteger10
delaydelay of sleep between 2 triesinteger1000
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (GApiStatus.OK, number_milliseconds_to_delete_detection)
  • (GApiStatus.KO, number_milliseconds_before_giving_up)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException
ServiceException

waitForFolderCreation

public static Object waitForFolderCreation(DocsService self,
                                           Object options,
                                           String folderName)
waits for folder creation by interrogating the DocsService periodically for this folder until it is found and sleeping between 2 tries... (not very elegant :) ) The result is a tuple [GApiStatus, number_of_milliseconds].
For example:
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForFolderCreation("folder1")
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForFolderCreation("folder1", maxcount:20, delay:2000)
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForFolderCreation("folder1", maxcount:20)
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForFolderCreation("folder1", delay:2000)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
folderName - the folder name to look for.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
maxcount: 15 delay: 2000 multiple: false Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
maxcountmaximum retry number before giving-upinteger10
delaydelay of sleep between 2 triesinteger1000
multipleverifies multiple folders have been createdbooleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (GApiStatus.OK, number_milliseconds_to_detect_document)
  • (GApiStatus.KO, number_milliseconds_before_giving_up)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException
ServiceException

public static Object waitForDocumentCreation(DocsService self,
                                             Object options,
                                             String docName)
waits for document creation by interrogating the DocsService periodically for this folder until it is found and sleeping between 2 tries... (not very elegant :) ) The result is a tuple [GApiStatus, number_of_milliseconds].

def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForDocumentCreation("doc1")

waitForDocumentCreation

public static Object waitForDocumentCreation(DocsService self,
                                             Object options,
                                             String docName,
                                             String folderName)
waits for document creation in a folder by interrogating the DocsService periodically for this folder until it is found and sleeping between 2 tries... (not very elegant :) ) The result is a tuple [GApiStatus, number_of_milliseconds].
For example:
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForDocumentCreation("doc1", "folder1")
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForDocumentCreation("doc1", "folder1", maxcount:20, delay:2000)
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForDocumentCreation("doc1", "folder1", maxcount:20)
def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForDocumentCreation("doc1", "folder1", delay:2000)

Parameters:
self - the DocsService externally initialized and authenticated.
docName - the document name to look for.
folderName - the folder name to look for.
options - Specifies function options as a map.
For example:
maxcount: 15 delay: 2000 multiple: false Accepted options are :
optiondescriptiontypedefault value
maxcountmaximum retry number before giving-upinteger10
delaydelay of sleep between 2 triesinteger1000
multipleverifies multiple folders have been createdbooleanfalse
Returns:
a tuple among:
  • (GApiStatus.OK, number_milliseconds_to_detect_document)
  • (GApiStatus.KO, number_milliseconds_before_giving_up)
Throws:
MalformedURLException
IOException

def (res, nb_ms) = service.waitForDocumentDeletion("doc1", "folder1", maxcount:20)
